li.a: High School Parent Forms and Links

a.span: MI School Data Visit Our Dashboard

div.p: Croswell-Lexington Schools, in partnership with students, families, and community, will equip all students with the skills to maximize educational and personal potential enabling them to become responsible, successful citizens.

The Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer Program (P-EBT) provides temporary funding to address emergency food needs for families affected by the pandemic.
P-EBT food assistance benefits will go to Michigan families with students ages 5-18 that are eligible for free or reduced-price school meals. This includes families currently receiving Food Assistance Program benefits, as well as those not currently enrolled in the program. No application is necessary for eligible families to receive P-EBT benefits.
Please see attached flyer for more information

div.p: Executive Order 2020-48, issued by Governor Gretchen Whitmer, suspends the monthly meeting requirement for local school boards until May 12, 2020. As a result, the Croswell-Lexington Community Schools Board of Education meeting scheduled for Monday, April 20, 2020, at 7 p.m., has been cancelled.

p.span: If the income for your family has recently been negatively affected by the COVID-19 closures, your student(s) may be eligible for the Free and Reduced Lunch program and possibly other services that may be offered from the State.

If your student(s) is already approved Free, there is no need to reapply. This application can be found on the District's website under the District tab, Food Services. An application will be available during the free meal pickup on Tuesday’s.
If you have any questions, or would like a F&R School Meals Application mailed to you, please email bsherbutt@croslex.org or phone (810) 679-1001.

div.p: On behalf of Croswell-Lexington Community schools we want to congratulate all instructional / support staff, students, and the community for achieving the ranking of #119 in MI among a total of approximately 1800 total high schools in Michigan! Go Pioneers!
